result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J Burczyk

records.addlTxt:
Defendant failed to post additional $250.00 cash bond by noon on 11-02-2022 as ordered by Judge Melvin at the Bail/Bond hearing on 10-27-2022.
Bail jumping from Waukesha County case nos. 20CM1672 and 20CT246.
Ext. Code = 3

CONDITIONS
Defendant is to post an ADDITIONAL $250.00 by noon on 11-2-2022.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle at all.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.

Case called at 11:44 a.m.
Attorney Charlie Hoffmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Angela Wang in court for Matthew J Burczyk.  
Defendant Matthew J Burczyk not in court. 
Due to the non-compliance with WCS, the Court will increase the defendant's cash bail by $250.00 for a total of $2,250.00.
The ADDITIONAL $250.00 Cash is to be posted by noon on 11-2-2022.
If the additional cash is not posted by the due date and time, the Court will issue a Capias.
Next date remains as previously set.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter dated 10-26-2022 received and filed.
Bail/bond hearing on October 27, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Attorney Wang requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:48 AM Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew J Burczyk in court by zoom video with attorney Angela Wang, in person.  File not called on the record.  Attorney Wang states they have not yet received the blood results on 22CM616 and requests a status date in about 60 days.  Court informs the defendant he currently has a few active warrants in Milwaukee County and advises him he should get in touch with Milwaukee to clear these issues up prior to the next date.  Defendant may appear by zoom for the next date.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance report dated 06-02-2022 received and filed.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Angela Wang

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle at all.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

02:55 PM Defendant Matthew J Burczyk in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
